action.action-desc: Mr. Crapo (for himself, Mr. Padilla, Mr. Risch, and Mr. Cornyn) submitted the following resolution; which was considered and agreed to

form.official-title: Recognizing and supporting the goals and ideals of National Forensic Science Week.

whereas.text: Whereas the Senate is committed to the use of forensic science in the investigation of crimes, the prosecution and conviction of the correct perpetrators of crimes, and the exoneration of innocent individuals falsely accused of crimes in the United States;

Whereas forensic science service providers address critical questions in civil and criminal investigations and trials in the United States, including by providing scientific conclusions relating to forensic evidence;
Whereas forensic science service providers partner with—

paragraph.text: Federal agencies to build and maintain criminal databases relating to latent prints, DNA, and other information relevant to criminal cases; and
Federal, State, and local agencies to ensure public safety;

whereas.text: Whereas forensic science service providers serve a vital role in the criminal justice system by providing scientific information to investigators and officers of the court; and
Whereas the week of September 14, 2025, to September 20, 2025, is recognized as National Forensic Science Week: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: supports the goals and ideals of National Forensic Science Week; and
recognizes that National Forensic Science Week provides a special opportunity for—

clause.text: to acknowledge the contributions of forensic scientists in the laboratories in which those individuals work;
to organize community events to encourage a better understanding of forensic science;

to provide tours to Federal, State, and local policymakers to assist those individuals in gaining better insight into the current capabilities of forensic science service providers and the future demands that forensic science service providers will face; and
to contact and invite local media outlets to cover events hosted during National Forensic Science Week;
to recognize, through formal commendation or resolution, the contributions of local forensic science laboratories to the communities of those policymakers;
to formally declare the week of September 14, 2025, to September 20, 2025, to be National Forensic Science Week by proclamation;
to visit local forensic science laboratories to gain an understanding of the capabilities and needs of those laboratories; and
to discuss the operational needs of State and local forensic science laboratories;

subparagraph.text: individuals in the United States, including members of the media—

clause.text: to attend community events sponsored by local forensic science laboratories;
to take tours of local forensic science laboratories; and
to ask local forensic science laboratories about the operational and legislative needs of those laboratories;

subparagraph.text: members of the media to highlight local news stories that focus on the work of local forensic science laboratories in the communities that those laboratories serve; and
public safety officers, law enforcement officers, and officers of the court—

clause.text: to attend community events sponsored by local forensic science laboratories;
to take tours of local forensic science laboratories;
to discuss the operational needs of State and local forensic science laboratories; and
to engage with local forensic science laboratories about working together more effectively.
